Motivation.text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
Motivation.author: Theodore Roosevelt

Motivation.text: Push yourself, because no one else is going to do it for you.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Don’t limit your challenges. Challenge your limits.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Everything you’ve ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
Motivation.author: George Addair

Motivation.text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
Motivation.author: Theodore Roosevelt

Motivation.text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
Motivation.author: Arthur Ashe

Motivation.text: Hard days are the best because that’s when champions rise.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Keep going. Everything you need will come to you at the perfect time.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Small daily improvements over time lead to stunning results.
Motivation.author: Robin Sharma

Motivation.text: Dreams don’t work unless you do.
Motivation.author: John C. Maxwell

Motivation.text: Opportunities don’t happen. You create them.
Motivation.author: Chris Grosser

Motivation.text: Start now. Start where you are. Start with fear.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Your only limit is your mind.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Don’t stop until you’re proud.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Your potential is endless.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
Motivation.author: Henry David Thoreau

Motivation.text: Make each day your masterpiece.
Motivation.author: John Wooden

Motivation.text: Push beyond your comfort zone.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Your future is created by what you do today, not tomorrow.
Motivation.author: Robert Kiyosaki

Motivation.text: Wake up with determination. Go to bed with satisfaction.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Don’t wait for inspiration. Become it.
Motivation.author: Original

Motivation.text: Stop wishing. Start doing.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Do something today that your future self will thank you for.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Success starts with self-discipline.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Sometimes later becomes never. Do it now.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Wisdom.text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
Wisdom.author: Aristotle

Wisdom.text: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.
Wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

Wisdom.text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
Wisdom.author: Socrates

Wisdom.text: Do not be wise in words—be wise in deeds.
Wisdom.author: Jewish Proverb

Wisdom.text: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
Wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey

Wisdom.text: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
Wisdom.author: Jimi Hendrix

Wisdom.text: A wise person knows that there is something to be learned from everyone.
Wisdom.author: Original

Wisdom.text: The fool wonders, the wise man asks.
Wisdom.author: Benjamin Disraeli

Wisdom.text: The simple things are often the truest.
Wisdom.author: Richard Bach

Wisdom.text: Wisdom begins in wonder.
Wisdom.author: Socrates

Wisdom.text: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
Wisdom.author: Aristotle

Wisdom.text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
Wisdom.author: Aristotle

Wisdom.text: Do not fear mistakes. You will know failure. Continue to reach out.
Wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

Wisdom.text: Wisdom is the reward you get for a lifetime of listening when you'd have preferred to talk.
Wisdom.author: Doug Larson

Wisdom.text: A wise man adapts himself to circumstances, as water shapes itself to the vessel that contains it.
Wisdom.author: Chinese Proverb

Wisdom.text: Education is the kindling of a flame, not the filling of a vessel.
Wisdom.author: Socrates

Wisdom.text: The more I read, the more I acquire, the more certain I am that I know nothing.
Wisdom.author: Voltaire

Wisdom.text: Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom.
Wisdom.author: Lao Tzu

Wisdom.text: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
Wisdom.author: Plato

Wisdom.text: Experience is the teacher of all things.
Wisdom.author: Julius Caesar

Wisdom.text: The art of being wise is knowing what to overlook.
Wisdom.author: William James

Wisdom.text: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
Wisdom.author: Saint Augustine

Wisdom.text: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
Wisdom.author: Francis Bacon

Wisdom.text: A wise man learns more from his enemies than a fool from his friends.
Wisdom.author: Baltasar Gracian

Wisdom.text: It’s not what you look at that matters, it’s what you see.
Wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

Discipline.text: Discipline is choosing between what you want now and what you want most.
Discipline.author: Abraham Lincoln

Discipline.text: Success doesn’t come from what you do occasionally. It comes from what you do consistently.
Discipline.author: Marie Forleo

Discipline.text: The pain of discipline is far less than the pain of regret.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.
Discipline.author: Jim Rohn

Discipline.text: What you stay focused on will grow.
Discipline.author: Roy T. Bennett

Discipline.text: Without discipline, there’s no life at all.
Discipline.author: Katharine Hepburn

Discipline.text: Your future is created by what you do today, not tomorrow.
Discipline.author: Robert Kiyosaki

Discipline.text: Small disciplines repeated with consistency lead to great achievements.
Discipline.author: John C. Maxwell

Discipline.text: The secret of success is discipline and persistence.
Discipline.author: Unknown

Discipline.text: Motivation gets you started. Discipline keeps you going.
Discipline.author: Original

Discipline.text: Discipline is remembering what you want.
Discipline.author: David Campbell

Discipline.text: Self-discipline begins with the mastery of your thoughts.
Discipline.author: Napoleon Hill

Discipline.text: The successful person has the habit of doing the things failures don't like to do.
Discipline.author: Thomas Edison

Discipline.text: Do not let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
Discipline.author: John Wooden

Discipline.text: We do today what they won’t, so tomorrow we can accomplish what they can’t.
Discipline.author: Darren Hardy

Discipline.text: The first and best victory is to conquer self.
Discipline.author: Plato

Discipline.text: Discipline is the soul of an army. It makes small numbers formidable; procures success to the weak.
Discipline.author: George Washington

Discipline.text: Mastering others is strength. Mastering yourself is true power.
Discipline.author: Lao Tzu

Discipline.text: He who conquers himself is the mightiest warrior.
Discipline.author: Confucius

Discipline.text: Self-respect is the fruit of discipline; the sense of dignity grows with the ability to say no to oneself.
Discipline.author: Abraham Joshua Heschel

Discipline.text: Discipline is doing what needs to be done, even when you don't want to do it.
Discipline.author: Unknown

Discipline.text: Success is nothing more than a few simple disciplines practiced every day.
Discipline.author: Jim Rohn

Discipline.text: The only discipline that lasts is self-discipline.
Discipline.author: Bovee

Discipline.text: Small disciplines done consistently will yield massive results.
Discipline.author: Robin Sharma

Discipline.text: Discipline is freedom.
Discipline.author: Jocko Willink

Faith & Spirituality.text: Let your faith be bigger than your fears.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Original

Faith & Spirituality.text: When you do things from your soul, you feel a river moving in you.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Rumi

Faith & Spirituality.text: Faith is taking the first step even when you don’t see the whole staircase.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Faith & Spirituality.text: Faith is the strength by which a shattered world shall emerge into the light.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Helen Keller

Faith & Spirituality.text: God has not forgotten you; He’s preparing you.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Original

Faith & Spirituality.text: Faith does not make things easy; it makes them possible.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Luke 1:37

Faith & Spirituality.text: To one who has faith, no explanation is necessary.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Thomas Aquinas

Faith & Spirituality.text: Faith is seeing light with your heart when all your eyes see is darkness.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Unknown

Faith & Spirituality.text: Feed your faith, and your fears will starve to death.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Original

Faith & Spirituality.text: Faith is the bird that feels the light and sings when the dawn is still dark.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Rabindranath Tagore

Faith & Spirituality.text: Faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Hebrews 11:1

Faith & Spirituality.text: Let your faith be bigger than your doubts.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Original

Faith & Spirituality.text: Do not let your hearts be troubled; believe in God, believe also in me.
Faith & Spirituality.author: John 14:1

Faith & Spirituality.text: Walk by faith, not by sight.
Faith & Spirituality.author: 2 Corinthians 5:7

Faith & Spirituality.text: Faith is not the belief that God will do what you want. It is the belief that God will do what is right.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Max Lucado

Faith & Spirituality.text: Faith is the strength that enables us to persevere.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Original

Faith & Spirituality.text: When fear knocks, let faith answer the door.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Original

Faith & Spirituality.text: Keep your faith strong; miracles happen every day.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Original

Faith & Spirituality.text: Faith is trusting God even when you don’t understand His plan.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Original

Faith & Spirituality.text: Prayer is the key of the morning and the bolt of the evening.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Faith & Spirituality.text: Faith sees the invisible, believes the unbelievable, and receives the impossible.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Original

Faith & Spirituality.text: Faith is not believing that God can, it’s knowing that He will.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Original

Faith & Spirituality.text: Faith makes all things possible.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Original

Faith & Spirituality.text: Faith is a knowledge within the heart, beyond the reach of proof.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Khalil Gibran

Faith & Spirituality.text: Have faith in your journey, even when you do not understand it.
Faith & Spirituality.author: Original

Courage & Confidence.text: Courage starts with showing up and letting ourselves be seen.
Courage & Confidence.author: Brené Brown

Courage & Confidence.text: You are stronger than you think, braver than you feel, and more capable than you imagine.
Courage & Confidence.author: Original

Courage & Confidence.text: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
Courage & Confidence.author: Confucius

Courage & Confidence.text: Courage is not having the strength to go on; it is going on when you don’t.
Courage & Confidence.author: Theodore Roosevelt

Courage & Confidence.text: Do not be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
Courage & Confidence.author: John D. Rockefeller

Courage & Confidence.text: Be the energy you want to attract.
Courage & Confidence.author: Original

Courage & Confidence.text: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.
Courage & Confidence.author: Steve Jobs

Courage & Confidence.text: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
Courage & Confidence.author: Nelson Mandela

Courage & Confidence.text: Success isn’t final; failure isn’t fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
Courage & Confidence.author: Winston Churchill

Courage & Confidence.text: Fear is a reaction. Courage is a decision.
Courage & Confidence.author: Winston Churchill

Courage & Confidence.text: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one’s courage.
Courage & Confidence.author: Anais Nin

Courage & Confidence.text: Be fearless in pursuit of what sets your soul on fire.
Courage & Confidence.author: Jennifer Lee

Courage & Confidence.text: Do one thing every day that scares you.
Courage & Confidence.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Courage & Confidence.text: Everything you’ve ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
Courage & Confidence.author: George Addair

Courage & Confidence.text: Courage doesn’t mean you don’t get afraid. Courage means you don’t let fear stop you.
Courage & Confidence.author: Bethany Hamilton

Courage & Confidence.text: Take risks: if you win, you will be happy; if you lose, you will be wise.
Courage & Confidence.author: Unknown

Courage & Confidence.text: It’s not the size of the dog in the fight, it’s the size of the fight in the dog.
Courage & Confidence.author: Mark Twain

Courage & Confidence.text: Do not fear failure. Fear being in the exact same place next year.
Courage & Confidence.author: Original

Courage & Confidence.text: The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
Courage & Confidence.author: Nelson Mandela

Courage & Confidence.text: Confidence comes not from always being right but from not fearing to be wrong.
Courage & Confidence.author: Peter T. Mcintyre

Courage & Confidence.text: One of the most courageous things you can do is identify yourself, know who you are, what you believe in and where you want to go.
Courage & Confidence.author: Shea Moisture

Courage & Confidence.text: Be strong, be fearless, be beautiful. And believe that anything is possible when you have the right people there to support you.
Courage & Confidence.author: Misty Copeland

Courage & Confidence.text: You gain strength, courage, and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.
Courage & Confidence.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Courage & Confidence.text: Act as if it were impossible to fail.
Courage & Confidence.author: Dorothy Broude

Courage & Confidence.text: Confidence is preparation. Everything else is beyond your control.
Courage & Confidence.author: Richard Kline

Happiness & Positivity.text: Don’t count the days. Make the days count.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Muhammad Ali

Happiness & Positivity.text: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Dalai Lama

Happiness & Positivity.text: Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Omar Khayyam

Happiness & Positivity.text: Gratitude turns what we have into enough.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Aesop

Happiness & Positivity.text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Dalai Lama

Happiness & Positivity.text: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Happiness & Positivity.text: A happy soul is the inevitable result of a heart burning with love.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Original

Happiness & Positivity.text: Count your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears.
Happiness & Positivity.author: John Lennon

Happiness & Positivity.text: Positive anything is better than negative nothing.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Elbert Hubbard

Happiness & Positivity.text: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Aristotle

Happiness & Positivity.text: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Albert Schweitzer

Happiness & Positivity.text: Happiness is only real when shared.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Christopher McCandless

Happiness & Positivity.text: Happiness is the best makeup.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Unknown

Happiness & Positivity.text: Smiles are contagious. Spread them everywhere.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Original

Happiness & Positivity.text: The most wasted of all days is one without laughter.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Nicolas Chamfort

Happiness & Positivity.text: Joy is not in things; it is in us.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Richard Wagner

Happiness & Positivity.text: Do more of what makes you happy.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Original

Happiness & Positivity.text: Happiness is a warm puppy.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Charles Schulz

Happiness & Positivity.text: Think of all the beauty still left around you and be happy.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Anne Frank

Happiness & Positivity.text: Happiness is a journey, not a destination.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Unknown

Happiness & Positivity.text: If you want to be happy, be.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Leo Tolstoy

Happiness & Positivity.text: Happiness is not by chance, but by choice.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Jim Rohn

Happiness & Positivity.text: A cheerful heart is good medicine.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Proverbs 17:22

Happiness & Positivity.text: Find joy in the ordinary.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Original

Happiness & Positivity.text: Happiness grows at our own firesides, and is not to be picked in strangers’ gardens.
Happiness & Positivity.author: Douglas Jerrold

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: Wisdom does not come overnight.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: Somali Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: African Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: Rain does not fall on one roof alone.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: Cameroonian Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: A bird does not change its feathers because the weather is bad.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: Nigerian Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: When the roots are deep, there is no reason to fear the wind.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: African Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: A child who is not embraced by the village will burn it down to feel its warmth.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: African Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: Knowledge is like a garden; if it is not cultivated, it cannot be harvested.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: African Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: No matter how long the night, the day is sure to come.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: African Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: A roaring lion kills no game.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: Ugandan Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: When two elephants fight, it is the grass that suffers.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: African Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: He who learns, teaches.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: Ethiopian Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: Unity is strength, division is weakness.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: Swahili Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: Even the best cooking pot will not produce food.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: African Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: Money can’t talk, yet it can make lies look true.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: South African Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: A man who uses force is afraid of reasoning.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: Kenyan Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: Do not look where you fell, but where you slipped.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: African Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: Wisdom is like a baobab tree; no one individual can embrace it.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: African Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: A wise man never knows all, only fools know everything.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: African Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: If the lion doesn’t tell his story, the hunter will.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: African Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: Even the best dancer on the stage must retire sometime.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: African Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: The child who is not taught by its parents will be taught by the world.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: African Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: No medicine can cure what happiness cannot.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: African Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: He who does not know one thing knows another.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: African Proverb

African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.text: Patience can cook a stone.
African Proverbs & Cultural Wisdom.author: African Proverb
